page.title: 10GRASS CROPS
page.content: Round bailing was invented in 1980. To start the grass is cut and left for a day. Then it is made into rows by a tractor and hay bob.(The hay bob rows up the grass.) Then the bailer bails the grass.The balier is square. When the bail has been made it is picked up and taken to the farm, where it is put in a bag until November, then it is fed to the cows. The bail is 4 feet high by 3 feet.The other kind is where the grass is mown and picked up by a forager which looks like a box with a tube on.When the grass is picked up it is put on a heap until November. You can get 30 round bails from 1 acre. Hay bailing is like round bailing, but the bails are 2 feet by 1 foot. The bailer is like a box with a tube on the back. The bails are used for bedding cows in the Winter.From an acre you can get 100 bails.
